questions.question_text: What are the channels you need to avoid not to have interference with DFS channels? (Choose 3)

discussion.content: A, B, C is correct answers (161 is UNII-3)
UNII2-52 to 64 and UNII2 extended 100 to 144

ABC is correct. DFS channels (In the United States) are channels 52-144.

https://www.networkcomputing.com/wireless-infrastructure/dynamic-frequency-selection-part-3-channel-dilemma

Answeres:

A. RSSI cell edge of -25
B. RSSI cell edge of -16
C. SNR of 25
D. Cell Overlap of 20%
E. RSSI -67

Correct answers should read:

C: SNR of 25
D: Cell overlap of 20%
E: RSSI cell edge of -67

questions.question_text: What is required from the deployment when using voice or video applications? (Choose 3)
Which operating mode is valid for controllers in a converged access architecture?

discussion.content:
Converged controllers only have 2 modes:
Mobility Agent
Mobility Controller 

The other options are groups, not modes for a single controller.

comments.content: In converged architecture, access layer switch became Controller

discussion.content: Answers A, B, C are all correct.

questions.question_text: Which wireless survey you do considering the "infrastructure" in the building?

discussion.content:
"Predictive surveyâ€”Analyze the environment to select AP locations when no APs have
been deployed yet; also called planning survey."
CCNA Wireless 200-355 Official Cert Guide page 171
Next page you can see details
correct answer is C. Predictive or Planning Surveys

There are three main types of wireless site surveys: passive, active, and predictive.
There is no such thing like a "Planning Survey" - planning is not the correct answer.
If infrastructure means "IT Infrastructure" (eg. APs), then "active" is correct.
If infrastructure means "Building Infrastructure" (eg. walls), then passive is correct.
